title: Thomas Gilbert Jr. Was Sentenced to 30 Years to Life for Killing His Father
text:
From Town & Country

Thomas Gilbert Jr., the Princeton graduate who killed his father over a decrease in his allowance, has been sentenced to 30 years-to-life for the crime.

The sentencing Friday came three months after Gilbert was convicted of fatally shooting Thomas Gilbert Sr. in his parents' Manhattan apartment. In addition to murder in the second degree, he was also found guilty of two counts of criminal weapon possession.

“Thomas Gilbert Sr. was a beloved member of his family and business community when his own son murdered him in a coldblooded killing,” Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. said Friday in a statement.

“But now, thanks to my office’s prosecutors, the defendant has finally been held accountable, and he will serve a life sentence for this unconscionable crime. While nothing can undo the tragedy of Mr. Gilbert’s death, I hope that the resolution of this case helps his loved ones as they continue to heal from this devastating loss.”

Gilbert's attorneys never denied the fact that their client killed his father; rather, they argued with an insanity defense, and according to CNN, on Friday, Shelley Gilbert, the victim's wife and defendant's mother, said that she wanted her son "to be given as light a sentence as possible."

"As I've said many times in court, we've been trying to get Tommy into a hospital for 15 years," she said. "He's too sick to be able to judge. He needs to be in a hospital, had he been so my husband would still be alive."

She also said she plans to appeal the sentencing.
